title: What do old coins tell about history? - Quora

response.answer_text: You get a glimpse of art from that time reflected in the main design. A sense of what that nation values by the legends and words it places upon the coin. The facts learned from history of what happened that year in the life of the nation. You hold in your hand something that directly connects to a specific point of time. You get a sense of the comparative wealth of a nation by the metal used for coinage. Finally, the imagination of who might have handled and used this coin in commerce. These are some things you learn studying old coins.

They tell you not just about history but culture and the general mindset… for example I was shock when i first saw Cuban coins all with the legend “Patria o muerte” (Translated as “Country or Death”)… it is a very heavy statement that reflects the oppression that many Cubans lived…. Another example comes from my main collection (I’m specialized in Tibetan coins due to the symbolism in their coins), you can find the Sun and Moon symbols compassion and wisdom as the basis to become a Buddha… or the 8 auspicious symbols (each one with profound significance), or many other symbols that reflects the richness of the dharma (Buddhist teachings) and the impact that they had in Tibetan society before being crushed by the Chinese (i can add “savages” but the truth be told as any other county they have good people and bad people, yet what the communist did and are still doing is very sad)….
